item.title: _international children's book day - Book for children (Poster)
陳芷晴的文章｜風傳媒
item.description: 陳芷晴的文章。風傳媒，是一個有國際視野、觀點犀利、正向力量的新媒體。

item.title: 'Chronic' street clutter makes London 'worse place to live,' report finds
item.description: Think twice before you drop your Pret cup onto a rubbish pile on the pavement As a global and capital city, London’s pavements may not be pedestrian-friendly, potentially earning it the title of a “worse place” to live, a report finds. The study, titled “Reducing Street Clutter in Central London,” evaluated Goodge Street in W1, Charing Cross Road in WC2, and Belvedere Road in SE1. It revealed that nearly half of the street clutter (47 per cent), including E-bikes, rubbish bags, and bollards, h

item.title: Finally, someone has created an tube map with how stations are actually pronounced
item.description: Don’t lie – you’ve definitely dared an international student to say ‘Leicester Square’ before London Underground is an iconic signature of the country with a long history. Created in 1931, the map has evolved throughout the time with new stations, new colours indicating tube lines, and expanding its system to more of London’s zones. However, non-English speakers may struggle with the station’s name, with few words and place names pronounced phonetically. Arcangelo Martiello, an Italian, has t

item.title: Ghost Island with UNESCO Awards, History of Salt Industry and Making｜Yim Tin Tsai
item.description: Yim Tin Tsai was once a desolate island, but it has received two UNESCO Asia-Pacific Awards. Despite being Hakka, the residents follow Catholicism. This video will introduce Hong Kong's salt industry, as well as the Hakka and Catholic cultures in Yim Tin Tsai, providing you with a glimpse into the diverse facets of Hong Kong.

item.title: Former Capital at Seaside Community, Oldest and Smallest Post Office｜Stanley
item.description: Stanley today is a seaside tourist destination: beaches, sunshine, and markets; Stanley, with its holiday atmosphere, was once the administrative centre of Hong Kong Island and a military stronghold. It is also home to some historic sites, such as the oldest functioning post office in Hong Kong. This video will introduce Stanley's attractions, taking you back to the Victorian era of British Hong Kong.

item.title: Abandoned Industrial Building, Slaughterhouse Renewed as Artist Village｜13 Streets
item.description: Before reclamation, Ma Tau Kok was the cape of To Kwa Wan. In the 1950s, Hong Kong's manufacturing industry flourished; thus, its economy developed rapidly, becoming one of the 'four Asian tigers'. Despite the 'Tong lau' on 13 Streets To Kwa Wan having colourful wall designs, the community has been abandoned due to the economic transformation. This video will share you the Hong Kong's industrial period in the past.

item.title: Pirate Stronghold and Quarry Site｜Lei Yue Mun fishing village
item.description: Lei Yue Mun fishing village has a history spanning over 150 years, with its origins dating back to the Qing Dynasty and the British colonial era in Hong Kong. This video will share you how Lei Yue Mun fishing village has changed throughout times and how policy shape today's culture there.

item.title: Creation Without Emotion: the Controversies of AI Art —
item.description: If you’ve been online recently, it’s hard to miss the plethora of AI-made content that seems to be on the rise nowadays. In particular, AI art generators have become a futuristic new trend both in the creative and social online spheres. However, despite its seemingly innocent appearance, it has also sparked controversy and raised ethical concerns around its infringement on the creative industry and data protection of images, which are widely shared by creators, artists, and the general public.

item.title: UCL Provost Admits University Is Underpaying Staff — Pi Media
item.description: There are several strikes happening in the United Kingdom, including in universities, partially due to inflation being at its highest level in 40 years. UCL has admitted that it has systematically underpaid staff for many years, a situation that may lead to deprivation of education in the near future even in the case of a highly-ranked university. Michael Spence, the president of UCL, told the Times Higher Education’s THE Campus Live event: “We’ve balanced the books by hugely increasing numbers

item.title: Let the Blank Papers Tell - How Protesters Express Themselves With No Freedom of Speech —
item.description: The largest protest in China, after the Tiananmen Square Massacre in 1989, is happening against the Zero-Covid policy where protesters hold a blank sheet of white paper known as ‘A4 Revolution’ or ‘White Paper Protests’. This has caught the attention of social media and is thought of as new and creative. On 24th November, a burning building in Urumqi caused 10 death tolls in which residents could not escape flames due to strict lockdown policies since last August. The tragedy angered the people

item.title: Students Report More Ongoing Problems at One Pool Street — Pi Media
item.description: The first term has nearly come to an end, but students living at One Pool Street - a UCL brand new accommodation - are still struggling with poor living conditions. One Pool Street is a self-catered hall for undergraduates and postgraduate students on the UCL East campus, which was scheduled to open last September. However, due to technical issues, students could not move in and were instead assigned to temporary halls – John Dodgson House, The Gantry London, Hyatt Regency Hotel Stratford, and

item.title: The Untold Struggles: Taiwan’s Medical Team’s Battle Against COVID-19
item.description: When coronavirus (COVID-19) made its unwelcome entrance in 2019, the medical community braced itself for a new wave of challenges. The memories of SARS still fresh, Taiwan’s medical professionals stood at the frontline once again, ready to confront this formidable enemy. To address the growing number of suspicious Covid-19 cases, a public hospital in Taipei made the difficult decision to convert its non-infectious disease unit, specifically the department of oncology, into isolation wards. Howe

item.title: Having Cultural Exchange with International Students in Taiwan!
item.description: To know more about how international students live in Taiwan, this article will share their interesting stories, including students from China, Malaysia, Thailand, and Saint Vincent and the Grenadines at National Chengchi University. ‘Being a student here has completely fulfilled my expectation towards university life since I was small.’ said Chong from Shanghai University, who enjoys the student life here, such as engaging in different activities — Photo Club, Taiwan and Mainland Exchange Asso

item.title: 說好的 50 年不變，才走一半已面目全非──當移民與背叛劃上等號，港人應何去何從？｜陳芷晴／讀者投書｜換日線
item.description: 今天（7/1）是香港回歸中國 25 週年，中國國家主席習近平特地赴港「歡慶」，然而，香港卻不見欣喜，社會甚至因「要走、要留」的選擇而有所齟齬。本文採訪留下來抗爭的人、收拾行李離開的人，談微妙而令人難受的「背叛說」。但別忘了，有些選擇，從來不是港人自願做的。

item.title: 🌊Flying Fish Festival🐟Taiwanese Indigenous Myth & Taboo｜The Tao People - The Island of Men #podcast
item.description: 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 Radio piece of 'COVER STORY Genesis! The Formation of The World．The Birth of the Island' - Mythology And Taboos, Formations of Sacred Orders. Written by Lee Jin-Xian. This story shares one of the Tao/Yami (達悟族) people's traditional ceremonies - The flying fish festival (飛魚祭) - who living the south-eastern coast of Taiwan called Orchid Island (蘭嶼). ❑ Fact you may want to know: Republic of China (ROC) is the official name of Taiwan, while the China we know nowadays is called People's Republic of China (PRC), which is different. If you're interested in the relationships between the two countries, it is worth looking at the 'Chinese Civil War', it explains a lot. 𝗕𝗮𝗰𝗸𝗴𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 𝗺𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗰 台灣原住民歌謠 Taiwans Indigenous Tribal Music Audio https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9kDT_Y1g51k

item.title: 香港確診數直線激增 北京頭大｜台灣要解封 何美鄉談與病毒共存的心理障礙｜全球聊天室 #鏡新聞
item.description: ◎ 香港的疫情蔓延，累積確診人數超越中國，病毒致死率超越美國，北京中央全面接管抗疫工作調派專家南下救火。 ◎防疫新階段，各國都在學習與病毒共存，公衛專家何美鄉，要提醒我們，台灣需要做好哪些準備。 ◎新冠疫情對現代人的生活方式，帶來了重大改變，我們也要回顧一下，過去有哪些重大的疫情，徹底改變了人類歷史的軌跡。 -- 鏡新聞官方網站👉https://www.mnews.tw/ 鏡新聞Facebook👉https://www.facebook.com/mnewstw/ 鏡新聞Instagram👉https://www.instagram.com/mnewstw/ 鏡新聞Line帳號👉https://lin.ee/4XsO8xi

item.title: 「來台灣讀書後，都不敢穿拖鞋上課了！」──4 位大學境外生的「驚喜」與「驚訝」｜陳芷晴／讀者投書｜換日線
item.description: 無論是本地生或外籍生，為追求夢想而背井離鄉的大家，來到一個全新、陌生的環境，都是一件不容易的挑戰。

item.title: draw_dream on Instagram
Speed Paint | The Man In The Moon🌕🌖🌗🌘🌑 #watercolor #speedpaint #fairytales
item.description: Watercolour painting (August 2020) inspired by the fairy tale ‘The Man In The Moon’. Filmed with iPhone 11/Edited with iMovie/Music with iMovie soundtrack ‘Soulmates’ by Homay Schmitz.

item.title: 曾獲金氏世界記錄！最長禮賓車有游泳池、高爾夫球場、停機坪 | 聯合新聞網
item.description: 加長型禮賓車的內部設計豪華，比一般轎車擁有更多元的設施。美國曾經擁有一輛「世界最長」的禮賓車，不僅有游泳池、高爾夫球場，還有直升機機坪！

item.title: LV全球可退貨但不包括中國 業者回應：在台依法提供退換貨服務
item.description: 近日，上海一名消費者想在加拿大鵝（Canada Goose）實體店面退貨，卻遭店員拒絕指所有中國大陸地區專門店，售賣的產品均不得退貨，「這個是中國區通用的一個條款」。而國際奢華品牌Louis Vuitton的條款也列明中國等地區不得退換貨品，其中還包括台灣，引起台灣網友熱議。Louis Vuitton（路易威登）台灣業者則回應，在台依照法律提供退換貨服務。

item.title: 你家耐震強度夠嗎？專家點出3個狀況看建築安全性
item.description: 台灣不時發生輕微地震，24日的宜蘭6.5級規模讓不少民眾感受到大樓搖晃。除了做好防範措施，專家提醒，也要確認自身住宅的耐震強度，並分析如果家中發現以下三個狀況，可能要注意大樓的耐震度。

item.title: 國立政治大學 新聞學系-最新消息
噗噗共乘來了：偏鄉Uber 部落頭目當運將 老少通載│TVBS新聞網
item.description: 由國立政治大學陳芷晴、林宣佑、郭又華完成的作品「噗噗共乘來了：偏鄉Uber 部落頭目當運將 老少通載」獲選第五屆「全球化文永續報導獎」社會價值獎！！！「噗噗共乘」號稱偏鄉Uber，並採用「需求反應式公共運輸服務（Demand Responsive Transit Service，DRTS）」的精神，招攬當地居民化身司機，由交通部科顧室針對偏鄉交通問題而研發的新計畫，委託鼎漢國際工程顧問股份有限公司營運，目前在台灣五處偏鄉服務，包含花蓮縣的卓溪鄉。

item.title: 香港馬桶與消費文化
item.description: Dive into our extensive resources on the topic that interests you. It's like a masterclass to be explored at your own pace.

item.title: 願景工程 Vision Project
item.description: #入圍就是肯定但我們也好想拿獎啊😆 由 #TVBS信望愛永續基金會 所主辦的《全球華文永續報導獎》公布入圍名單，聯合報系總共有6項優秀作品入圍 ！！ 💡專業組平面類〈萊豬叩關調查報導〉、〈108課綱追蹤報導〉、〈碳鎖台灣〉 💡專業組融媒體類〈六都新印象〉、〈無助的沈默〉 💡音頻類獎項：〈綠能煉金術：第一首訪談原因大公開 揭漁電共生黑幕〉 ...

item.title: 旅遊者 Traveller
item.description: 疫情時代下，帶給你不一樣的出國想像...
